stories.headline: Making the switch to ACS
stories.summary: The American Community Survey of the Census Bureau faces regular budget challenges, but it is set to replace the long-form census by 2010, providing annual data across various geographic scales.

stories.headline: Rolling hazards in rail cargo
stories.summary: A train derailment near San Bernardino raised concerns about rail transport of hazardous chemicals, revealing flaws in track inspections and communication issues that endangered local residents.

stories.headline: ER gridlock exposed
stories.summary: An investigation into emergency room delays in Baltimore reveals a concerning pattern of hospital alerts and extended wait times, suggesting systemic healthcare bottlenecks.

stories.headline: Endangered data helps find deadly mercury
stories.summary: The potential reduction in EPA's Toxic Release Inventory data collection threatens environmental reporting. Examining mercury pollution in chlor-alkali plants uncovered significant emissions.

stories.headline: Stats help deflate big crowd count
stories.summary: Crowd counting techniques learned at a CAR boot camp help provide a more accurate estimate of attendees at a local parade, debunking inflated claims by organizers.
